meanings.definition: Belief or opinion contrary to orthodox religious doctrine.
meanings.sent1: The preacher warned the congregation about the heresy of denying the existence of God.
meanings.sent2: The council condemned the heresy of worshiping multiple gods.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a heresy to suggest that pizza is better than ice cream.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, wearing socks with sandals is considered a heresy.
meanings.sent5: The heresy of believing the Earth is flat is easily debunked by science.

meanings.definition: Any belief or theory that is strongly at variance with established beliefs, customs, etc.
meanings.sent1: The new scientific discovery was met with accusations of heresy from traditionalists.
meanings.sent2: The artist's unconventional style was seen as a heresy by the art critics.
meanings.sent3: It would be a heresy in the cooking world to put ketchup on a fine dining dish.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, using auto-tune excessively is considered a heresy by purists.
meanings.sent5: The heresy of suggesting that chocolate is better than vanilla ice cream caused a heated debate.
